content: All deleted files are moved to 'Trash'. Restore files deleted by mistake or delete them permanently. Files in 'Trash' are automatically deleted after 30 days. Please note, that the files deleted from the 'Trash' cannot be restored any longer.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message when a file or folder has been moved to the "Trash", informing users that deleted files cannot be restored and will be automatically deleted after 30 days. It appears in the UI as part of an empty screen for archive folders, specifically on the header.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English content uses single quotes for 'Trash', while the Arabic translation uses Arabic script within double quotes. This inconsistency in quotation marks can be jarring for users.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change the Arabic translation to use single quotes around 'Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù‡Ù…Ù„Ø§Øª' to match the English original: "ÙŠØªÙ… Ù†Ù‚Ù„ Ø¬Ù…ÙŠØ¹ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„ÙØ§Øª Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø­Ø°ÙˆÙØ© Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ 'Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù‡Ù…Ù„Ø§Øª'."

'Ã–mÃ¼rlÃ¼k' is a bit strong and could be replaced with a more common term for permanent deletion.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English "Files in 'Trash' are automatically deleted after 30 days" is translated as "'SÉ™bÉ™tdÉ™n' fayllar 30 gÃ¼ndÉ™n sonra avtomatik silinir.".  Using the possessive 'SÉ™bÉ™tdÉ™n' can be slightly ambiguous.  It is better to use a more general phrasing.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English "Please note that the files deleted from the 'Trash' cannot be restored any longer" is translated as "LÃ¼tfÉ™n, nÉ™zÉ™rÉ™ alÄ±n ki, 'SÉ™bÉ™tdÉ™n' silinÉ™n fayllar bir dÉ™ bÉ™rpa oluna bilmÉ™yÉ™cÉ™klÉ™r.". Similar to previous issues, 'SÉ™bÉ™tdÉ™n' is not the most natural wording. The phrasing 'bir dÉ™' (anymore) can be simplified.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Files:TrashEmptyDescription' implies the description is related to emptying the trash. The translation starts by describing the 'Trash' as a place where deleted files are moved, which is accurate but doesn't directly address emptying it.  A more focused translation for emptying the trash might begin by referencing the action of emptying.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a phrasing like: 'When you empty the 'Trash', all files within are permanently deleted.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The original English uses single quotes for 'Trash'. The Bulgarian translation also uses single quotes, which is correct, but consistent style should be maintained.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent use of single quotes around 'ĞšĞ¾ÑˆÑ‡Ğµ' throughout the text.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'restore them by mistake' is translated as 'ĞºĞ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ±ÑŠĞ´Ğ°Ñ‚ Ğ¸Ğ·Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ³Ñ€ĞµÑˆĞºĞ°'. While understandable, it's slightly awkward. It implies the files are being deleted again.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more natural phrasing like: 'ĞºĞ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ·Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ³Ñ€ĞµÑˆĞºĞ°' (which you deleted by mistake)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Czech translation consistently uses quotation marks ('KoÅ¡') around "Trash". While acceptable, it might be more consistent to use italics or bolding for emphasis, or to avoid quotation marks entirely.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using italics (e.g., *KoÅ¡*) or bolding (e.g., **KoÅ¡**) for 'Trash' throughout the text, or removing the quotation marks. Consistent styling is preferred.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'ProsÃ­m berte v Ãºvahu' is a somewhat formal and slightly awkward translation of 'Please note'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'restore files deleted by mistake' is translated as 'wiederherstellen, wenn sie versehentlich gelÃ¶scht wurden'. A more natural and precise translation would be 'Sie kÃ¶nnen Dateien, die versehentlich gelÃ¶scht wurden, wiederherstellen' or 'Sie kÃ¶nnen Dateien wiederherstellen, falls sie versehentlich gelÃ¶scht wurden'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'delete them permanently' is translated as 'unwiderruflich entfernen'. While correct, 'dauerhaft lÃ¶schen' might be more common and clearer in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: dauerhaft lÃ¶schen

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence 'Please note, that the files deleted from the 'Trash' cannot be restored any longer' is translated as 'Bitte beachten Sie, wenn Sie die Dateien aus dem 'Papierkorb' entfernen, kÃ¶nnen diese nicht mehr wiederhergestellt werden.' This is grammatically awkward. It implies the user deleting from the trash prevents restoration. A better translation would focus on the deletion process itself.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bitte beachten Sie, dass Dateien, die aus dem 'Papierkorb' gelÃ¶scht wurden, nicht mehr wiederhergestellt werden kÃ¶nnen.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure feels a bit clunky. Separating the sentences with a period and more consistent flow will improve readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Die Sektion 'Papierkorb' enthÃ¤lt alle gelÃ¶schten Dateien. Sie kÃ¶nnen diese Dokumente entweder wiederherstellen, wenn sie versehentlich gelÃ¶scht wurden, oder dauerhaft lÃ¶schen. Dateien im 'Papierkorb' werden nach 30 Tagen automatisch gelÃ¶scht. Bitte beachten Sie, dass Dateien, die aus dem 'Papierkorb' gelÃ¶scht wurden, nicht mehr wiederhergestellt werden kÃ¶nnen.

Using 'ÎšÎ¬Î´Î¿Ï‚ Î±Ï€Î¿ÏÏÎ¹Î¼Î¼Î¬Ï„Ï‰Î½' is a more literal translation of 'waste bin' and less accurate to the intended meaning.

(matching the earlier term) or 'Î¤Î± Î±ÏÏ‡ÎµÎ¯Î± ÏƒÏ„Î¿Î½ ÎšÎ¬Î´Î¿ Î±Î½Î±ÎºÏÎºÎ»Ï‰ÏƒÎ·Ï‚ Î´Î¹Î±Î³ÏÎ¬Ï†Î¿Î½Ï„Î±Î¹ Î±Ï…Ï„ÏŒÎ¼Î±Ï„Î± Î¼ÎµÏ„Î¬ Î±Ï€ÏŒ 30 Î·Î¼Î­ÏÎµÏ‚.' â€“ perhaps 'Î‘Ï…Ï„ÏŒÎ¼Î±Ï„Î± Î´Î¹Î±Î³ÏÎ¬Ï†Î¿Î½Ï„Î±Î¹ Î¼ÎµÏ„Î¬ Î±Ï€ÏŒ 30 Î·Î¼Î­ÏÎµÏ‚.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Usted puede restaurarlos en el caso si ellos fueron eliminados por error' is grammatically awkward. 'En el caso si' is redundant and unnecessarily formal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Usted puede restaurarlos si fueron eliminados por error / Puede restaurarlos si fueron eliminados por error

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'cuando usted elimina los archivos de la 'Papelera de reciclaje' ellos no pueden ser recuperados' is a bit clunky.  'Ellos' is redundant.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: cuando usted elimina los archivos de la 'Papelera de reciclaje', no pueden ser recuperados.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: Inconsistency in capitalization of 'Papelera de reciclaje'. It's not consistently in lower case.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent use of lowercase 'papelera de reciclaje' throughout the text, unless specific brand guidelines dictate otherwise.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'delete them permanently' is translated as 'les Ã©liminer de maniÃ¨re permanente'. While not incorrect, 'les supprimer dÃ©finitivement' is a more common and natural phrasing.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Please note, that the files deleted from the 'Trash' cannot be restored any longer' is translated as 'Il est Ã  noter que quand vous supprimez les fichiers de la 'Corbeille' ils ne peuvent pas Ãªtre restaurÃ©s.'. This is a bit convoluted. A clearer translation would be 'Veuillez noter que les fichiers supprimÃ©s de la 'Corbeille' ne peuvent plus Ãªtre restaurÃ©s.'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: Inconsistent use of single quotes. The English version uses single quotes for 'Trash', while the Armenian translation sometimes uses them and sometimes doesn't. This should be consistent.

ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Maintain consistent use of double quotes around 'Cestino' throughout the translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "restore files deleted by mistake" is not accurately translated. 'àºŸàº·à»‰àº™â€‹àºŸàº¹â€‹à»„àºŸàº¥â€‹à»Œâ€‹àº—àºµà»ˆâ€‹àº–àº·àºâ€‹àº¥àº»àºšâ€‹à»‚àº”àºâ€‹àº„àº§àº²àº¡â€‹àºœàº´àº”â€‹àºàº²àº”' literally translates to 'restore files that were deleted by mistake'. While technically correct, it could be improved for clarity and natural flow in Lao.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rewording to something like 'àºŸàº·à»‰àº™â€‹àºŸàº¹â€‹à»„àºŸàº¥â€‹à»Œâ€‹àº—àºµà»ˆâ€‹àº–àº·àºâ€‹àº¥àº»àºšâ€‹à»‚àº”àºâ€‹à»€àºˆàº»à»‰àº²â€‹à»‚àº”àºâ€‹àºšà»à»ˆâ€‹à»„àº”à»‰â€‹àº•àº±à»‰àº‡à»ƒàºˆ' (restore files that you deleted unintentionally) or 'àºŸàº·à»‰àº™â€‹àºŸàº¹â€‹à»„àºŸàº¥â€‹à»Œâ€‹àº—àºµà»ˆâ€‹àº–àº·àºâ€‹àº¥àº»àºšâ€‹àº”à»‰àº§àºâ€‹àº„àº§àº²àº¡â€‹à¸œà¸´à¸”â€‹àºàº²àº”' (restore files deleted with a mistake).

While technically accurate, 'àº¢à»ˆàº²àº‡â€‹àº–àº²â€‹àº§àº­àº™' (permanently) can sound overly formal or slightly awkward in this context. A more natural phrasing might be preferable.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: Inconsistency in quotation marks. English uses single quotes, Lao uses Lao quotes. This isn't a significant error, but maintaining consistency would improve readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider consistently using Lao quotation marks throughout the text, or English single quotes if the application/system dictates it.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Faili miskastÄ“ tiek automÄtiski izdzÄ“sti' is grammatically awkward. 'MiskastÄ“' isn't standard Latvian for 'Trash'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Restore files deleted by mistake' is translated as 'Je kan deze terugzetten als ze per ongeluk verwijderd zijn'. ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English content uses single quotes for 'Trash'. The Romanian translation uses both single ('CoÈ™ul') and double quotes. Inconsistency in quotation marks should be corrected.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Use consistent quotation marks throughout the Romanian translation. Either use single quotes like the English version ('CoÈ™ul') or use double quotes consistently.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'restore' is translated as 'restabiliÈ›i', which is technically correct but could be improved for clarity and naturalness.  'Recupera' is often preferred for 'restore' in a digital context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'recuperaÈ›i' instead of 'restabiliÈ›i' for improved clarity.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Sinhala word 'à¶¯à·€à·ƒà·Š ğ‘‡¬ (30) à¶šà¶§' is an unconventional way to write '30 days'. While understandable, it's not standard Sinhala usage.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English content uses single quotes for 'Trash'. While the Slovak translation uses single quotes as well for 'KÃ´Å¡', consistency is important.
